intro: Celosia polygonoides, commonly known as the flame flower or crown of thorns, is a flowering plant native to Africa. It belongs to the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its vibrant, spiky bracts that resemble flames. The plant typically grows as an upright shrub, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while the flowers are clustered in dense, colorful inflorescences. Celosia polygonoides is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is relatively drought-tolerant.
